00008 const wxString wxMMLPainter::abc
00009         = wxT("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ");
00010 
00011 wxMMLPainter::wxMMLPainter(wxDC *dc) {
00012         p = dc;
00013         debugdrawtext = false;
00014         absx = absy = 0;
00015         defaultfont = dc->GetFont();
00016         pointsize = dc->GetFont().GetPointSize();
00017 }
00018 void

00022 float
00023 wxMMLPainter::dpi(bool horizontal) const {
00024         wxCoord w, h;
00025         w = h = 0;
00026         p->GetSize(&w, &h);
00027         if (horizontal) {
00028                 return w;
00029         } else {
00030                 return h;
00031         }
00032 }
00033 /* In Qt the total height of a font is given as ascent + 1 + descent.
00034    The 1 is for the baseline.
00035    In a continuous coordinate system, the baseline is infinetly thin.
00036    So there, the total height is ascent + descent. To make sure the total
00037    font size in both systems is equal, we add the 1 for the baseline to the
00038    ascent of the font. The ascent is the best choice because it is the larger
00039    value and it's relative change is smaller. */
00040 float
00041 wxMMLPainter::fontAscent() const {
00042         int w, h, d;
00043         w = h = d = 0;
00044         p->GetTextExtent(abc, &w, &h, &d);
00045         return h-d;
00046 }
00047 float
00048 wxMMLPainter::fontDescent() const {
00049         int w, h, d;
00050         w = h = d = 0;
00051         p->GetTextExtent(abc, &w, &h, &d);
00052         return d;
00053 }
00054 float
00055 wxMMLPainter::stringWidth(const DOMString &s) const {
00056         int w, h, d;
00057         p->GetTextExtent(wxstring(s), &w, &h, &d);
00058         return w;
00059 }
00060 /* Em
00061  * A font-relative measure encoded by the font. Before electronic typesetting,
00062  * an "em" was the width of an "M" in the font. In modern usage, an "em" is
00063  * either specified by the designer of the font or is taken to be the height
00064  * (point size) of the font. Em's are typically used for font-relative
00065  * horizontal sizes. */
00066 float
00067 wxMMLPainter::em() const {
00068         return p->GetFont().GetPointSize();
00069 }
00070 /* Ex
00071  * A font-relative measure that is the height of an "x" in the font. "ex"s are
00072  * typically used for font-relative vertical sizes. */
00073 float
00074 wxMMLPainter::ex() const {
00075         int w, h;
00076         wxString s(wxT("x"));
00077         p->GetTextExtent(s, &w, &h);
00078         h = p->GetFont().GetPointSize(); // debug statement
00079         return h;
00080 }
00081 MathColor
00082 wxMMLPainter::mathColor() const {
00083         MathColor mc;
00084         wxColour wc = p->GetTextForeground();
00085         return mathcolor(wc);
00086 }
00087 MathColor
00088 wxMMLPainter::highlightColor(uchar level) const {
00089         MathColor mc;
00090         wxColour bg = p->GetBackground().GetColour();
00091         wxColour hl = wxSystemSettings::GetColour(wxSYS_COLOUR_HIGHLIGHT);
00092         int r, g, b;
00093         int lm = int(pow(2,level));
00094         r = (hl.Red() - bg.Red())/lm + bg.Red();
00095         g = (hl.Green() - bg.Green())/lm + bg.Green();
00096         b = (hl.Blue() - bg.Blue())/lm + bg.Blue();
00097     printf("highlight: %i, %i, %i\n", r, g, b);
00098         mc.setRgb(r, g, b);
00099         return mc;
00100 }
00101 MathColor
00102 wxMMLPainter::selectionColor() const {
00103         MathColor mc;
00104         wxColour sc = wxSystemSettings::GetColour(wxSYS_COLOUR_HIGHLIGHT);
00105         mc.setRgb(sc.Red(), sc.Green(), sc.Blue());
00106     printf("selection: %i, %i, %i\n", sc.Red(), sc.Green(), sc.Blue());
00107         return mc;
00108 }
00109 void
00110 wxMMLPainter::setMathVariant(MathVariant mv) {
00111         wxFont f = p->GetFont();
00112         switch (mv) {
00113         case (NORMAL):
00114                 // strangely, setting the default values for a font results in
00115                 // an invisible font! so we use a stored value for the default
00116                 // font
00117                 //f.SetFamily(wxROMAN);
00118                 //f.SetWeight(wxNORMAL);
00119                 //f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00120                 f = defaultfont;
00121                 f.SetPointSize(pointsize);
00122                 break;
00123         case (BOLD):
00124                 f.SetFamily(wxROMAN);
00125                 f.SetWeight(wxBOLD);
00126                 f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00127                 break;
00128         case (ITALIC):
00129                 f.SetFamily(wxROMAN);
00130                 f.SetWeight(wxNORMAL);
00131                 f.SetStyle(wxITALIC);
00132                 break;
00133         case (BOLD_ITALIC):
00134                 f.SetFamily(wxROMAN);
00135                 f.SetWeight(wxBOLD);
00136                 f.SetStyle(wxITALIC);
00137                 break;
00138         case (DOUBLE_STRUCK): break;
00139         case (SCRIPT):
00140                 f.SetFamily(wxSCRIPT);
00141                 f.SetWeight(wxNORMAL);
00142                 f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00143                 break;
00144         case (BOLD_SCRIPT):
00145                 f.SetFamily(wxSCRIPT);
00146                 f.SetWeight(wxBOLD);
00147                 f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00148                 break;
00149         case (FRAKTUR): break;
00150         case (BOLD_FRAKTUR): break;
00151         case (SANS_SERIF):
00152                 f.SetFamily(wxSWISS);
00153                 f.SetWeight(wxNORMAL);
00154                 f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00155                 break;
00156         case (BOLD_SANS_SERIF):
00157                 f.SetFamily(wxSWISS);
00158                 f.SetWeight(wxBOLD);
00159                 f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00160                 break;
00161         case (SANS_SERIF_ITALIC):
00162                 f.SetFamily(wxSWISS);
00163                 f.SetWeight(wxNORMAL);
00164                 f.SetStyle(wxITALIC);
00165                 break;
00166         case (SANS_SERIF_BOLD_ITALIC):
00167                 f.SetFamily(wxSWISS);
00168                 f.SetWeight(wxBOLD);
00169                 f.SetStyle(wxITALIC);
00170                 break;
00171         case (MONOSPACE):
00172                 f.SetFamily(wxMODERN);
00173                 f.SetWeight(wxNORMAL);
00174                 f.SetStyle(wxNORMAL);
00175                 break;
00176         default:
00177                 printf("value for MathVariant is out of range\n");
00178         }
00179         p->SetFont(f);
00180 }
00181 void
00182 wxMMLPainter::setMathColor(MathColor mc) {
00183         wxPen pen = p->GetPen();
00184         if (mc.isTransparent()) {
00185                 // mathcolor cannot be transparent, only background can
00186                 pen.SetStyle(wxTRANSPARENT);
00187         } else {
00188                 wxColour c;
00189                 c.Set(mc.r(), mc.g(), mc.b());
00190                 pen.SetColour(c);
00191         }
00192         p->SetPen(pen);
00193 }
00194 void
00195 wxMMLPainter::setMathBackground(MathColor mc) {
00196         wxBrush brush = p->GetBrush();
00197         if (mc.isTransparent()) {
00198                 // mathcolor cannot be transparent, only background can
00199                 brush.SetStyle(wxTRANSPARENT);
00200         } else {
00201                 wxColour c;
00202                 c.Set(mc.r(), mc.g(), mc.b());
00203                 brush.SetColour(c);
00204         }
00205         p->SetBrush(brush);
00206 }
00207 void
00208 wxMMLPainter::setFontSize(float pt) {
00209         wxFont f = p->GetFont();
00210         pointsize = int(pt);
00211         f.SetPointSize(pointsize);
00212         p->SetFont(f);

00214 void
00215 wxMMLPainter::setLineThickness(float t) { // thickness in px
00216         wxPen pen = p->GetPen();
00217         int it = f2l(t);
00218         pen.SetWidth(it ?it :1);
00219         p->SetPen(pen);
00220 }
00221 float
00222 wxMMLPainter::fontSize() const {
00223         return p->GetFont().GetPointSize();
00224 }
00225 void
00226 wxMMLPainter::drawLine(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2,
00227                 float linethickness) {
00228         wxPen backup;
00229         if (linethickness) {
00230                 wxPen pen = p->GetPen();
00231                 backup = pen;
00232                 pen.SetWidth(f2l(linethickness));
00233                 p->SetPen(pen);
00234         }
00235 
00236         p->DrawLine(f2xc(x1), f2yc(y1), f2xc(x2), f2yc(y2));
00237 
00238         if (linethickness) {
00239                 p->SetPen(backup);
00240         }
00241 }
00242 void
00243 wxMMLPainter::drawRect(float x, float y, float w, float h) {
00244         p->DrawRectangle(f2xc(x), f2yc(y), f2l(w), f2l(h));
00245 }
00246 void
00247 wxMMLPainter::fillRect(float x, float y, float w, float h, const MathColor &bg,
00248                 const MathColor &fg) {
00249         wxBrush b, bbackup;
00250         wxPen pen, pbackup;
00251         b = bbackup = p->GetBrush();
00252         pen = pbackup = p->GetPen();
00253         b.SetStyle(wxSOLID);
00254         if (bg.isTransparent()) {
00255                 b.SetColour(p->GetPen().GetColour());
00256         } else {
00257                 b.SetColour(wxcolour(bg));
00258         }
00259         p->SetBrush(b);
00260         int style = 0;
00261         if (fg.isTransparent()) {
00262                 style = p->GetPen().GetStyle();
00263                 pen.SetStyle(wxTRANSPARENT);
00264         } else {
00265                 pen.SetColour(wxcolour(fg));
00266         }
00267         p->SetPen(pen);
00268         p->DrawRectangle(f2xc(x), f2yc(y), f2l(w), f2l(h));
00269         p->SetPen(pbackup);
00270         p->SetBrush(bbackup);
00271 }
00272 /* we map the points (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (x3, y3) to the points (0, 0), (1, 0),
00273    (0, 1), then we draw a rectangle that covers these points. */
00274 void
00275 wxMMLPainter::fillParallelogram(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2,
00276                 float x3, float y3) {
00277         wxPoint list[4];
00278         list[0] = wxPoint(f2xc(x1), f2yc(y1));
00279         list[1] = wxPoint(f2xc(x2), f2yc(y2));
00280         list[2] = wxPoint(f2xc(x3), f2yc(y3));
00281         list[3] = wxPoint(f2xc(x3+x2-x1), f2yc(y3+y2-y1));
00282         p->DrawPolygon(4, list);
00283 }
00284 void
00285 wxMMLPainter::drawPolygon(int n, float *x, float *y) {
00286         wxBrush b, bbackup;
00287         b = bbackup = p->GetBrush();
00288         b.SetStyle(wxSOLID);
00289         b.SetColour(p->GetPen().GetColour());
00290         p->SetBrush(b);
00291         wxPoint *list = new wxPoint[n];
00292         for (int i=0; i<n; ++i) {
00293                 list[i] = wxPoint(f2xc(x[i]), f2yc(y[i]));
00294         }
00295         p->DrawPolygon(n, list);
00296         delete [] list;
00297         p->SetBrush(bbackup);
00298 }
00299 void
00300 wxMMLPainter::drawText(const DOMString &s) {
00301         if (debugdrawtext) {
00302                 drawOutline(s);
00303         }
00304         float y = fontAscent();
00305         p->DrawText(wxstring(s), f2xc(0), f2yc(-y));
00306 }
00307 /* wxwindows cannot stretch fonts, so we draw at the centre of the designated
00308    area */
00309 void
00310 wxMMLPainter::drawText(const DOMString &s, float w) {
00311         float y = fontAscent();
00312         float sw = f2l(stringWidth(s));
00313         float hdiff = w-sw;
00314         p->DrawText(wxstring(s), f2xc(hdiff/2), f2yc(-y));
00315 }
00316 /* draw the string s with current font, but stretch it to fit the given
00317    height (a+d). Keep the width the same as the width specified by
00318    stringWidth(s); */
00319 /* wxwindows cannot stretch fonts, so we draw at the centre of the designated
00320    area */
00321 void
00322 wxMMLPainter::drawText(const DOMString &s, float a, float d) {
00323         float fa = fontAscent();
00324         float fd = fontDescent();
00325         float vdiff = d-fd - a+fa;
00326         p->DrawText(wxstring(s), f2xc(0), f2yc(vdiff/2-fa));
00327 }
00328 /* wxwindows cannot stretch fonts, so we draw at the centre of the designated
00329    area */
00330 void
00331 wxMMLPainter::drawText(const DOMString &s, float w, float a, float d) {
00332         float sw = f2l(stringWidth(s));
00333         float hdiff = w-sw;
00334         float fa = fontAscent();
00335         float fd = fontDescent();
00336         float vdiff = d-fd - a+fa;
00337         p->DrawText(wxstring(s), f2xc(hdiff/2), f2yc(vdiff/2-fa));
00338 }
00339 void
00340 wxMMLPainter::drawOutline(const DOMString &s) {
00341         int a = int(fontAscent());
00342         int d = int(fontDescent());
00343         int w = int(stringWidth(s));
00344          // total character area
00345         wxPen pen, pbackup;
00346         pen = pbackup = p->GetPen();
00347         wxBrush brush, bbackup;
00348         brush = bbackup = p->GetBrush();
00349         pen.SetColour(*wxGREEN);
00350         brush.SetColour(wxColour(0,255,255));
00351         p->SetPen(pen);
00352         p->SetBrush(brush);
00353         p->DrawRectangle(f2xc(0), f2yc(-a), f2l(w), f2l(a+d+1));
00354         p->SetBrush(bbackup);
00355         p->DrawRectangle(f2xc(0), f2yc(-a), f2l(w), f2l(a+1)); // ascent area
00356         p->DrawRectangle(f2xc(0), f2yc(0), f2l(w), f2l(d+1)); // descent area
00357         p->SetPen(pbackup);
00358 }
00359 void
00360 wxMMLPainter::translate(float x, float y) {
00361         absx += x;
00362         absy += y;
00363 }
00364 /* from the documentation of wxwindows it's not entirely clear how to convert
00365    to and from utf16 (domstring) strings to wxString object, so, we'll just
00366    copy the characters one by one until we know more. */
00367 wxString
00368 wxstring(const DOMString &d) {
00369         wxString s;
00370         uint len = d.length();
00371         s.resize(len);
00372         for (uint i=0; i<len; ++i) {
00373                 wxChar c = d[i];
00374                 s[i] = c;
00375         }
00376         return s;
00377 }
00378 DOMString
00379 domstring(const wxString &s) {
00380         DOMString d;
00381         uint len = s.length();
00382         d.resize(len);
00383         for (uint i=0; i<len; ++i) {
00384                 d[i] = s[i];
00385         }
00386         return d;
00387 }
00388 // convert a coordinate float value to an integer float value
00389 // we always convert such values to the lower value
00390 int
00391 wxMMLPainter::f2xc(float f) const{
00392         f += absx;
00393         return (f<0) ? int(f)-1 : int(f);
00394 }
00395 int
00396 wxMMLPainter::f2yc(float f) const {
00397         f += absy;
00398         return (f<0) ? int(f)-1 : int(f);
00399 }
00400 // convert a length/size float value to an integer float value
00401 // we always convert such values to nearest value
00402 int
00403 wxMMLPainter::f2l(float f) const {
00404         f += 0.5;
00405         return (f<0) ? int(f)-1 : int(f);
00406 }
00407 MathColor
00408 wxMMLPainter::mathcolor(const wxColour &wc) const {
00409         MathColor mc;
00410         if (wc.Ok()) {
00411                 mc.setRgb(wc.Red(), wc.Blue(), wc.Green());
00412         }
00413         return mc;
00414 }
00415 wxColour
00416 wxMMLPainter::wxcolour(const MathColor &mc) const {
00417         wxColour wx = wxNullColour;
00418         if (!mc.isTransparent()) {
00419                 wx.Set(mc.r(), mc.g(), mc.b());
00420         }
00421         return wx;
00422 }
